Authors:
Chanokned Senwanna, Sinang Hongsanan, Kevin D Hyde,
Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon, Sirinapa Konta, Yong Wang
Title:
First report of the sexual morph of Pseudofusicoccum
adansoniae on Para rubber
Keywords:
Botryosphaeriales / Morphology / New sexual record /
Phylogeny / Taxonomy
Abstract:
Pseudofusicoccum species were collected from branches and
twigs of Hevea brasilliensis in Phayao Province, northern Thailand.
Pseudofusicoccum adansoniae and P. ardesiacum were identified and are
new records for Hevea brasilliensis. Pseudofusicoccum is known only by
its asexual morph. Here, we describe the sexual morph for P. adansoniae.
The sexual morph is characterized by immersed, uniloculate ascomata,
cylindric-clavate asci with a long pedicel, well-developed ocular
chamber and short clavate, hyaline, aseptate ascospores, surrounded by a
mucilaginous sheath. The connection between the sexual and asexual morph
of P. adansoniae was confirmed by phylogenetic analyses of a combined
ITS, LSU, TEF1 and Î²-tubulin dataset. Descriptions, illustrations and
molecular data are provided for the taxa.
